# isFlushWindowDisabled

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the window’s flushing ability is disabled.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var isFlushWindowDisabled: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] when the window’s flushing ability has been disabled; otherwise, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Related Documentation

- **disableFlushing()**: Disables the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/flush()] method for the window.
- **enableFlushing()**: Reenables the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/flush()] method for the window after it was disabled through a previous [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/disableFlushing()] message.

## Properties

- **backingLocation**: The location of the window’s backing store.
- **preferredBackingLocation**: A Boolean value that indicates the preferred location for the window’s backing store.
- **isOneShot**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the window device the window manages is freed when it’s removed from the screen list.
- **drawers**: The collection of drawers associated with the window.
- **showsResizeIndicator**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the window’s resize indicator is visible.
- **isAutodisplay**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the window automatically displays views that need to be displayed.
- **graphicsContext**: The graphics context associated with the window for the current thread.
- **windowRef**: The Carbon window reference associated with the window, creating one if necessary.
